abstract: A designer who used to work at Facebook tracked and compiled all of his daily activities for the past year as a sort of art project at the nexus of monitoring and big data.
snippet: A designer who used to work at Facebook tracked and compiled all of his daily activities for the past year as a sort of art project at the nexus of monitoring and big data.
lead_paragraph: The information designer Nicholas Felton likes data: the more data, the better. That’s why for a number of years, he has released a compilation of information that he has collected and analyzed about himself, including where he’s gone, the books he’s read and whom he’s talked to.

headline.main: A Life in Data: Nicholas Felton’s Self-Surveillance
